definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

sentences.english: The government never rejected Taipei Mayor Ma Ying-joue's visa application to visit Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 政府从来没有拒绝马英九来港的签证申请。

sentences.english: Visitor arrivals dropped by one-third between mid-March and mid-April.
sentences.chinese: 三月中至四月中期间来港旅客人数下跌三分之一。

sentences.english: More overseas talent is likely to be allowed in.
sentences.chinese: 未来将会允许更多专才来港。

sentences.english: The Immigration Department admitted 3,745 professionals from the mainland last year.
sentences.chinese: 入境处去年批准3，745名内地专才来港。

sentences.english: My knowledge all came in drips and drabs after I got there.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是来港后一点一滴逐渐认识的。

sentences.english: If Hong Kong dollars depreciate against with RMB, it is easy to attract more China tourist to visit Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 若港元对人民币贬值，会较易吸引内地游客来港消费。

sentences.english: Hoa has just arrived from Vietnam.
The government will also increase testing of chickens that cross the border with mainland China.
sentences.chinese: 政府还将对内地来港鸡只加强检验。

sentences.english: The Immigration Department admitted 3，745 professionals from the mainland last year.
sentences.chinese: 入境处去年批准3，745名内地专才来港。

sentences.english: I'm honoured to be here and looking forward to tomorrow night.
sentences.chinese: 我很荣幸能够来港作赛，并很期待明晚的赛事。

definition: Hong Kong Stock Exchange/abbr. for 香港交易所
mainland China (PRC excluding Hong Kong and Macau, but including islands such as Hainan)/Japan (used in Taiwan during Japanese colonization)
sum of money raised (in a share subscription)
red chip stocks (Chinese company stocks incorporated outside mainland China and listed in the Hong Kong stock exchange)
to amend an ordinance (abbr. for 修改條例|修改条例[xiu1 gai3 tiao2 li4])
